Data preparation package¶

download_dataset script¶

booksuggest.data.download_dataset.main(download_url, output_filepath)¶

Downloads data from the download_url and saves it in the output_filepath.

Parameters:
  • download_url (str) – Url from which the data should be downloaded.
  • output_filepath (str) – Filepath to which the results should be saved.

extract_xml_files script¶

booksuggest.data.extract_xml_files.main(xml_archive_path, output_dir)¶

Extract .xml files from archive xml_archive_path to output_dir

xml_parser module¶

booksuggest.data.xml_parser.extract_all_book_xml_roots(xmls_dir)[source]¶

Extracts book element from .xml files located in given directory.

Parameters:xmls_dir (str) – Directory with .xml files.
Yields:Iterable[etree.Element] – Iterable of book elements.
Return type:Iterable[<cyfunction Element at 0x7efee19ee270>]

clean_book script¶

booksuggest.data.clean_book.main(book_filepath, books_xml_dir, output_filepath)¶

Extracts additional data about books from .xml files and joins it with previous data.

Parameters:
  • book_filepath (str) – Book data frame.
  • books_xml_dir (str) – Directory with books .xml files.
  • output_filepath (str) – Output filepath.
booksuggest.data.clean_book.extract_book_extra_info(xmls_dir)[source]¶

Extracts extra information about books from .xml files in given directory.

Parameters:xmls_dir (str) – Directory with .xml files.
Returns:List of (work_id, isbn13, description) book data.
Return type:List[Tuple[int, str, str]]
booksuggest.data.clean_book.merge_book_data(book_df, book_extra_info_df)[source]¶

Merges standard book data with new extra info.

Parameters:
  • book_df (pd.DataFrame) – Book data frame.
  • book_extra_info_df (pd.DataFrame) – Book extra info data frame.
Returns:

Book data frame with additional description column.
Return type:

pd.DataFrame
booksuggest.data.clean_book.process_book_extra_info(book_extra_info_rows)[source]¶

Processes books extra data and transforms it to a data frame.

Apart from joining data it also removes HTML tags from the description column.

Parameters:book_extra_info_rows (List[Tuple[int, str, str]]) – List of (work_id, isbn13, description) book data.
Returns:Data frame with columns corresponding to input tuple.
Return type:pd.DataFrame

clean_book_tags script¶

booksuggest.data.clean_book_tags.main(book_filepath, book_tags_filepath, tags_filepath, genres_filepath, output_filepath)¶

Cleans up the book tags data.

Aggregates tags for all editions for specific book by switching to book_id, filters out tags which do not indicate book genre and replaces tags ids with names.

Parameters:
  • book_filepath (str) – Book data frame filepath.
  • book_tags_filepath (str) – Book tags data frame filepath.
  • tags_filepath (str) – Tags data frame filepath.
  • genres_filepath (str) – Path to a file containing valid genre names.
  • output_filepath (str) – Output filepath.
booksuggest.data.clean_book_tags.filter_non_genres_tags(tags_df, genres)[source]¶

Filters out the non-genre tags.

Parameters:
  • tags_df (pd.DataFrame) – Tags data frame.
  • genres (List[str]) – List of genres.
Returns:

Filtered tags data frame.
Return type:

pd.DataFrame
booksuggest.data.clean_book_tags.join_tag_names(book_tags_df, tags_df)[source]¶

Replaces tag_id column with tag_name data.

Parameters:
  • book_tags_df (pd.DataFrame) – Book tags data frame.
  • tags_df (pd.DataFrame) – Tags data frame.
Returns:

Book tags data frame with tag names and tag ids.
Return type:

pd.DataFrame
booksuggest.data.clean_book_tags.switch_to_book_id(book_df, book_tags_df)[source]¶

Changes ids from goodreads_book_id to abstract book_id, thus aggregating tags for all books editions.

Parameters:
  • book_df (pd.DataFrame) – Books data frame.
  • book_tags_df (pd.DataFrame) – Book tags data frame.
Returns:

Books data frame with switched ids.
Return type:

pd.DataFrame

prepare_description script¶

Description cleaning functions.

This module contains functions used for cleaning book descriptions. The main script is responsible for preparing descriptions that will be later used for feature extraction.

booksuggest.data.prepare_description.main(input_filepath, output_filepath, remove_nouns)¶

Cleans books descriptions.

Parameters:
  • input_filepath (str) – Input file to clean descriptions in.
  • output_filepath (str) – Filepath where the results should be saved.
  • remove_nouns (bool) – Whether to remove proper nouns from text.
booksuggest.data.prepare_description.clean_descriptions(input_filepath, remove_proper_nouns)[source]¶

Cleans all descriptions in the data from the input file.

Parameters:
  • input_filepath (str) – Filepath to the data containing a description column that will be cleaned.
  • remove_proper_nouns (bool) – Whether to remove proper nouns from text.
Returns:

The original data frame but with the description column cleaned.
Return type:

pd.DataFrame
booksuggest.data.prepare_description.clean_single_description(description, remove_proper_nouns)[source]¶

Prepares the description for the tf-idf method.

Parameters:
  • description (str) – Book description.
  • remove_proper_nouns (bool) – Whether to remove proper nouns from text.
Returns:

Description with removed punctuation, stopwords and stemmed, lemmatized vocabulary.
Return type:

str

prepare_similar_books script¶

booksuggest.data.prepare_similar_books.main(books_xml_dir, books_filepath, output_filepath)¶

Extracts information about similar books from .xml files in given directory.

Parameters:
  • books_xml_dir (str) – Directory with books’ .xml files.
  • books_filepath (str) – Books data frame filepath.
  • output_filepath (str) – Output filepath.
booksuggest.data.prepare_similar_books.extract_similar_books(xmls_dir)[source]¶

Extracts similar_books element children for each book xml file in xmls_dir directory.

Parameters:xmls_dir (str) – Directory with xml files.
Returns:List of (work_id, similar_book_work_id).
Return type:List[Tuple[int, int]]
booksuggest.data.prepare_similar_books.process_similar_books(similar_books_rows)[source]¶

Converts list of (work_id, similar_book_work_id) to a data frame.

Parameters:similar_books_rows (List[Tuple[int, int]]) – Similar books data.
Returns:Data frame with input data.
Return type:pd.DataFrame
booksuggest.data.prepare_similar_books.switch_to_book_id(similar_books_df, book_df)[source]¶

Change ids of books from work id to abstract book_id

Parameters:
  • similar_books_df (pd.DataFrame) – Similar books data.
  • book_df (pd.DataFrame) – Data about book_id: work_id association.
Returns:

Data frame with only book_id used.
Return type:

pd.DataFrame

ratings_train_test_split script¶

booksuggest.data.ratings_train_test_split.main(ratings_filepath, trainset_filepath, testset_filepath)¶

Splits the data about ratings into traning and test datasets.

Split function is randomized, but with predefined seed to allow for reproducible results.

Parameters:
  • ratings_filepath (str) – Ratings data frame filepath.
  • trainset_filepath (str) – Output filepath for training dataset.
  • testset_filepath (str) – Output filepath for test dataset.
